Definition: In this task, you will be shown a sentence. You should determine whether it is overruling or non-overruling. In law, an overruling sentence nullifies a previous case decision as a precedent by a constitutionally valid statute or a decision by the same or higher ranking court which establishes a different rule on the point of law involved.

Positive Examples.explanation: It's a good example. This sentence doesn't overrule any law, So it's non-overruling.

Positive Examples.input: we disapprove cooper and craven to the extent that they may be read to conflict.
Positive Examples.explanation: The word "disapprove" shows that cooper and craven case isn't valid anymore and it's a overruling sentence.

Positive Examples.input: the analysis below is included to satisfy our own, independent obligation to ensure that we have jurisdiction.
Positive Examples.explanation: It's a good example. This sentence doesn't overrule any law, So it's non-overruling.

Negative Examples.input: my colleagues argue that their imposition of sua sponte estoppel avoids ""unnecessary judicial waste.""
Negative Examples.explanation: This sentence doesn't overrule any rule, So it is incorrect.

Negative Examples.input: for the reasons that follow, we approve the first district in the instant case and disapprove the decisions of the fourth district.
Negative Examples.explanation: This sentence disapproves the decisions of the fourth district, So It's overruling.

Instances.input: the portion of anderson v. calderon, 232 f.3d 1053, that reached a contrary conclusion is overruled.
but the most relevant definition of ""such"" is ""of the character, quality, or extent previously indicated or implied.""
(in-home supportive services, supra, 152 cal.app.3d at p. 733.)

for these reasons, we overrule the language of people v. mcgee, supra, 1 cal.2d 611, and its progeny, to the extent it suggests a court lacks fundamental subject matter jurisdiction over a time-barred criminal action.
accordingly cochran and similar past holdings are hereby expressly overruled insofar as they collide with the enlightened view now here adopted.

to the extent that adame v. hernandez, 327 ga.app. 869, 874(3)(b), 761 s.e.2d 402 (2014), holds that the trial court must support, with written findings, its exercise of discretion and consideration of the best interest of the child for whom child support is being awarded when applying a theoretical child support order under ocga  19615(f)(5)(c), it is hereby overruled.
